Text: USTeleNet TransactionJust to followup on our discussion yesterday regarding the accounting treatment assuming that USTeleNet owns the switch and that we purchase the switch and lease it back to them under a capital lease the following would occur The asset would stay on their books however it would be markedup to FMV as evidenced by the purchase price They would defer the gain if any over the assets life They would record a payable on their balance sheet and recognize interest expense in their PL as payments are made We would record the payment of cash to them and book a receivable and deferred interest income to be recognized over the lease term Essentially we are lending them money equal to the FMV of their asset and receiving interest payments in return ie direct financing lease I would be happy to go into more detail at your request Please let me know as issues develop and I will assist as necessary Regards Todd Rimmer Director EWS Transaction Support Phone Fax Cell
